free: #e Sister, if you have time, bark ... cut my banana trees and bark (them).
#c 阿姐，如果你有時間的話，削 ... 砍我的香蕉樹，削樹皮。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe(新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe(新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e Okay, we two can do it together.
#c 可以啊，我們兩個一起做。

free: #e I want to weave, but I cannot bark (banana trees). I am lazy.
#c 我想織布，可是我不會削樹皮，我很懶惰。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe(新社)

free: #e Don’t be lazy. If we do it slowly, we can definitely finish (barking) one banana.
#c 不要懶惰，我們慢慢做，一定會做完一根香蕉。

#c 好像有人在趕你要快點。

free: #e (When) I barked banana trees, my hand was cut. I don’t dare to (bark) again.
#c 我割香蕉，割到我的手，我不敢做了。
#n tepuq-an-ku lima-ku: 我割到我的手

free: #e Do it slowly. If (we) do it in a hurry, (our) hands will be cut.
#c 慢慢做，快的話會割的手。

free: #e We had to hurry up. We were too slow.
#c 我們要趕快。我們太慢了。

#c 結果我的手被割到了。再也不敢削樹皮了。

#c 我想要織布，可是我想我不能削樹皮。

free: #e When will you be able to do it?
#c 你這樣什麼時候才會做?

#c 你說不會，那到底什麼時候才會?

#c 削樹皮的時候，我的動作就是這樣子。

free: #e Being lazy is not good. We must manage to do it, and we’ll be skilled gradually.
#c 懶惰不好，我們一定要勉強做，慢慢就會了。

#c 你一直說不會，結果就真的不會，而且也懶的做。
